class.name: AnimationPlayer
class.description: An animation player is used for general purpose playback of [Animation] resources. It contains a dictionary of animations (referenced by name) and custom blend times between their transitions. Additionally, animations can be played and blended in different channels.

method.name: add_animation
method.description: Adds [code]animation[/code] to the player accessible with the key [code]name[/code].

method.name: advance
method.description: Shifts position in the animation timeline. Delta is the time in seconds to shift. Events between the current frame and [code]delta[/code] are handled.

method.name: animation_get_next
method.description: Returns the name of the next animation in the queue.

method.name: animation_set_next
method.description: Triggers the [code]anim_to[/code] animation when the [code]anim_from[/code] animation completes.

method.name: clear_caches
method.description: [AnimationPlayer] caches animated nodes. It may not notice if a node disappears, so clear_caches forces it to update the cache again.

method.name: clear_queue
method.description: Clears all queued, unplayed animations.

method.name: find_animation
method.description: Returns the name of [code]animation[/code] or empty string if not found.

method.name: get_animation
method.description: Returns the [Animation] with key [code]name[/code] or [code]null[/code] if not found.

method.name: get_animation_list
method.description: Returns the list of stored animation names.

method.name: get_blend_time
method.description: Get the blend time (in seconds) between two animations, referenced by their names.

method.name: get_playing_speed
method.description: Get the actual playing speed of current animation or 0 if not playing. This speed is the [code]playback_speed[/code] property multiplied by [code]custom_speed[/code] argument specified when calling the [code]play[/code] method.

method.name: has_animation
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the [AnimationPlayer] stores an [Animation] with key [code]name[/code].

method.name: is_playing
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if playing an animation.

method.name: play
method.description: Play the animation with key [code]name[/code]. Custom speed and blend times can be set. If custom speed is negative (-1), 'from_end' being true can play the animation backwards. If the animation has been paused by [code]stop(true)[/code] it will be resumed. Calling [code]play()[/code] without arguments will also resume the animation.

method.name: play_backwards
method.description: Play the animation with key [code]name[/code] in reverse. If the animation has been paused by [code]stop(true)[/code] it will be resumed backwards. Calling [code]play_backwards()[/code] without arguments will also resume the animation backwards.

method.name: queue
method.description: Queue an animation for playback once the current one is done.

method.name: remove_animation
method.description: Remove the animation with key [code]name[/code].

method.name: rename_animation
method.description: Rename an existing animation with key [code]name[/code] to [code]newname[/code].

method.name: seek
method.description: Seek the animation to the [code]seconds[/code] point in time (in seconds). If [code]update[/code] is [code]true[/code], the animation updates too, otherwise it updates at process time. Events between the current frame and [code]seconds[/code] are skipped.

method.name: set_blend_time
method.description: Specify a blend time (in seconds) between two animations, referenced by their names.

method.name: stop
method.description: Stop the currently playing animation. If [code]reset[/code] is [code]true[/code], the animation position is reset to [code]0[/code] and the playback speed is reset to [code]1.0[/code]. If [code]reset[/code] is [code]false[/code], then calling [code]play()[/code] without arguments or [code]play("same_as_before")[/code] will resume the animation. Works the same for the [code]play_backwards()[/code] method.

members.member: If playing, the current animation; otherwise, the animation last played. When set, would change the animation, but would not play it unless currently playing. See also [member current_animation].
The name of the animation to play when the scene loads. Default value: [code]""[/code].
The name of the current animation, "" if not playing anything. When being set, does not restart the animation. See also [method play]. Default value: [code]""[/code].
The length (in seconds) of the currently being played animation.
The position (in seconds) of the currently playing animation.
If [code]true[/code], updates animations in response to process-related notifications. Default value: [code]true[/code].
The default time in which to blend animations. Ranges from 0 to 4096 with 0.01 precision. Default value: [code]0[/code].
The process notification in which to update animations. Default value: [code]ANIMATION_PROCESS_IDLE[/code].

The speed scaling ratio. For instance, if this value is 1 then the animation plays at normal speed. If it's 0.5 then it plays at half speed. If it's 2 then it plays at double speed. Default value: [code]1[/code].
The node from which node path references will travel. Default value: [code]".."[/code].

signal.name: animation_changed
signal.description: If the currently being played animation changes, this signal will notify of such change.

signal.name: animation_finished
signal.description: Notifies when an animation finished playing.

signal.name: animation_started
signal.description: Notifies when an animation starts playing.

constants.constant: Process animation during the physics process. This is especially useful when animating physics bodies.
Process animation during the idle process.
Do not process animation. Use the 'advance' method to process the animation manually.
